body_content.explanation: exact: a written instruction used to tell a musician that they should perform at the exact tempo (= speed) that is shown:
examples: The third movement uses one of his trademark tempo indications, Tempo giusto.
The duo plays six movements characterized by a stricter tempo giusto style.
The composer's own interpretations are infinitely preferable to the inexpressive tempo giusto playing of so many modern pianists.

body_content.explanation: suitable: a written instruction used to tell a musician that they should perform at a suitable speed:
examples: The first movement leads into a fractured fugue, played allegro giusto.
The initial larghetto progresses to an "allegro giusto" marking.
